content.1: On that night could not the king sleep, and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles; and they were read before the king.
content.2: And it was found written, that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the king’s chamberlains, the keepers of the door, who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.
content.3: And the king said, What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this? Then said the king’s servants that ministered unto him, There is nothing done for him.
content.5: And the king’s servants said unto him, Behold, Haman standeth in the court. And the king said, Let him come in.
content.6: So Haman came in. And the king said unto him, What shall be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour? Now Haman thought in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honour more than to myself?
content.7: And Haman answered the king, For the man whom the king delighteth to honour,
content.8: Let the royal apparel be brought which the king
content.9: And let this apparel and horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king’s most noble princes, that they may array the man
content.10: Then the king said to Haman, Make haste,
content.11: Then took Haman the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaimed before him, Thus shall it be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour.
content.12: And Mordecai came again to the king’s gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning, and having his head covered.
